abstract: United States expands longstanding sanctions against central African guerrilla group the Lord's Resistance Army and founder Joseph Kony; leader, who is wanted for war crimes, has evaded capture for nearly three decades.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Broadens Its Sanctions on Warlord and His Group
headline.main: U.S. Broadens Sanctions on Joseph Kony and His Group

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The Treasury Department action against Mr. Kony and the Lord’s Resistance Army, an African guerrilla organization, could hamper their ability to raise money by selling poached ivory.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department action against Mr. Kony and the Lord’s Resistance Army, an African guerrilla organization, could hamper their ability to raise money by selling poached ivory.
